issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify Rideable.messageOnRide() as a no-argument method returning a String (messageOnRide(): String) and the example usage in the template's Main calls r.messageOnRide() with no arguments. However, the solution repository defines the Rideable interface and implementations with a different signature: messageOnRide(String equipment). Pig and Seal implement messageOnRide(String) and their returned messages include the equipment ("with ..."). This parameter mismatch between the specification/template and the solution will confuse students and prevent them from following the described design or using the provided Main example and tests that expect a no-argument messageOnRide().
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the Rideable API consistent with the problem statement and template. Either:

1) Preferred fix (align solution with specification): Change Rideable.messageOnRide to a no-argument method (String messageOnRide()) and update Pig and Seal to implement the no-arg method, returning exactly the message specified in the problem ("Riding on [Animal Type] [name]"). Also update any solution tests or code that call the method accordingly.

OR

2) If the intent was to include an equipment parameter, update the problem statement (UML and textual description) and the template Main to show the parameter and the revised expected return string (e.g., "Riding on [Animal Type] [name] with [equipment]"), so the template, specification, and solution all match.

issues.description: The problem statement and the template expect Rideable.messageOnRide() to be a no-argument method returning a String (signature: messageOnRide(): String). The solution repository defines Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) (takes a String parameter) and implements that signature in Pig and Seal. The template's Main calls r.messageOnRide() with no arguments, and the problem text/diagram and Part 2 description explicitly show and describe a parameterless messageOnRide(). This mismatch forces students to reconcile two different method contracts for the same conceptual operation (riding an animal) and will cause compilation/runtime mismatches or confusion about the expected method signature and return value.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the Rideable API across artifacts. Prefer updating the solution to match the problem and template: change Rideable.messageOnRide(String) to a no-argument method messageOnRide() returning the string "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]", and update Pig and Seal implementations accordingly (remove the equipment parameter and adjust return value). Alternatively, if the equipment parameter is intended pedagogically, update the problem statement and template (Main) to call and document messageOnRide(String equipment) consistently.
